Text: NonCritical News QPC RE SHORTTERM FIRM CAPACITY AVAILABLE Short term firm transportation capacity of Dth is available on Questar Pipeline Company from receipt point CO plant outlet to delivery point Elberta Utah on a firstcomefirstserve basis for the period November through November Short term capacity will be at a Dth monthly reservation rate Parties interested in this firm capacity should contact their Questar Pipeline marketing representative or call

Critical News QPC RE CLAY BASIN INTERRUPTIBLE STORAGE SERVICE Effective for gas day November Questar Pipeline Company Questar will allow injections up to an additional Dth of interruptible storage service at Clay Basin see critical notice for original Dth However Questar will NOT allow gas quantities in FSS to be transferred to ISS If you have questions please contact your Questar Customer Service representative or call

Critical Maintenance QPC RE NOTICE TO CLAY BASIN CAPACITY HOLDERS Questar Pipeline Company Questar is planning to perform Clay Basin inventory verification and deliverability tests beginning April These tests will involve a day shutin of Clay Basin for reservoir gas inventory verification followed immediately by a day field deliverability test D uring the day shutin Clay Basin customers will not be able to utilize their storage service However in order to facilitate the day deliverability test an Operational Flow Order OFO will be issued and storage capacity holders will be required to take a prorata share of their withdrawal capacity from a total volume of dth in a hour period Questar will work with storage customers to facilitate transportation of their gas supply during this time period Questar is interested in finding ways to minimize the impact of this testing on its shippers Please contact your Questar marketing repesentative to discuss the testing process
